docs.snippet: A court challenge over the difficult process for airline passengers to remove their names from the U.S. government's list of suspected terrorists banned from flying is taking an unexpected twist, now focusing on the mysterious ways federal agents ...
docs.lead_paragraph: A court challenge over the difficult process for airline passengers to remove their names from the U.S. government's list of suspected terrorists banned from flying is taking an unexpected twist, now focusing on the mysterious ways federal agents add passenger names to the no-fly list in the first place.

headline.main: No-Fly List Case Could Shed Light on US Terror Predictions
headline.print_headline: No-Fly List Case Could Shed Light on US Terror Predictions

docs.snippet: Daniel Scioli beat his main rival, Mauricio Macri, by eight points in an all-party primary, but it proved close enough to raise uncertainty over who would prevail in October....
docs.lead_paragraph: Daniel Scioli beat his main rival, Mauricio Macri, by eight points in an all-party primary, but it proved close enough to raise uncertainty over who would prevail in October.
docs.abstract: Daniel Scioli narrowly prevails in Argentina's all-party presidential primary, but slim margin of victory over rival Mauricio Macri leaves future of nation's politics in doubt;  general elections are set to take place in October.

headline.main: Primaries in Argentina Point to a Close Presidential Race
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | The Americas; Argentina: Primary Results Give Hope to Both Major Candidates

docs.snippet: Our cars, fridges and even bank safes are connected to the Internet. It’s making us vulnerable in new and alarming ways....
docs.lead_paragraph: Our cars, fridges and even bank safes are connected to the Internet. It’s making us vulnerable in new and alarming ways.
docs.abstract: Zeynep Tufekci Op-Ed article underscores dangers of so-called Internet of Things, particularly vulnerability of many smart objects connected to digital networks and thus susceptible to hacking; notes also that more pernicious risk such objects pose is violation of consumers' privacy; suggests companies must make initial investment to grow Internet of Things upon more secure foundation, and isolate critical functions on Internet-connected objects.

headline.main: Why ‘Smart’ Objects May Be a Dumb Idea
